snippet: Anthony D. Marshall, convicted in 2009 of stealing millions of dollars from his socialite mother, is scheduled to start a sentence of one to three years soon.
abstract: Anthony D Marshall, convicted in 2009 of stealing millions of dollars from his socialite mother Brooke Astor, is scheduled to start a sentence of one to three years; his lawyer have unleashed a flurry of legal efforts to keep their aging client out of prison, including a motion revisiting an allegation that a juror felt threatened into a guilty vote at Marshall's trial.
lead_paragraph: Anthony D. Marshall, convicted in 2009 of stealing millions of dollars from his socialite mother, is scheduled to start a sentence of one to three years soon.

headline.main: As Prison Term Nears, Lawyers for Astor’s Son Fight On
headline.print_headline: Prison Near, Lawyers of Astor’s Son Fight On
